Deprecated API

Contents

  • Deprecated Interfaces
  • Deprecated Classes
  • Deprecated Fields
  • Deprecated Methods
  • Deprecated Constructors
  • Deprecated Interfaces 
    Interface and Description
    com.android.volley.toolbox.HttpStack
    This interface should be avoided as it depends on the deprecated Apache HTTP library. Use BaseHttpStack to avoid this dependency. This class may be removed in a future release of Volley.
    com.android.volley.RequestQueue.RequestFinishedListener
  • Deprecated Classes 
    Class and Description
    com.android.volley.toolbox.HttpClientStack
    The Apache HTTP library on Android is deprecated. Use HurlStack or another BaseHttpStack implementation.
  • Deprecated Fields 
    Field and Description
    com.android.volley.toolbox.BasicNetwork.mHttpStack
    Should never have been exposed in the API. This field may be removed in a future release of Volley.
  • Deprecated Methods 
    Method and Description
    com.android.volley.RequestQueue.addRequestFinishedListener(RequestQueue.RequestFinishedListener<T>)
    com.android.volley.toolbox.BasicNetwork.convertHeaders(Header[])
    Should never have been exposed in the API. This method may be removed in a future release of Volley.
    com.android.volley.Request.getPostBody()
    Use Request.getBody() instead.
    com.android.volley.toolbox.JsonRequest.getPostBody()
    Use JsonRequest.getBody().
    com.android.volley.Request.getPostBodyContentType()
    Use Request.getBodyContentType() instead.
    com.android.volley.toolbox.JsonRequest.getPostBodyContentType()
    Use JsonRequest.getBodyContentType().
    com.android.volley.Request.getPostParams()
    Use Request.getParams() instead.
    com.android.volley.Request.getPostParamsEncoding()
    Use Request.getParamsEncoding() instead.
    com.android.volley.toolbox.Volley.newRequestQueue(Context, HttpStack)
    Use Volley.newRequestQueue(Context, BaseHttpStack) instead to avoid depending on Apache HTTP. This method may be removed in a future release of Volley.
    com.android.volley.toolbox.BaseHttpStack.performRequest(Request<?>, Map<String, String>)
    use BaseHttpStack.executeRequest(com.android.volley.Request<?>, java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.String>) instead to avoid a dependency on the deprecated Apache HTTP library. Nothing in Volley's own source calls this method. However, since BasicNetwork.mHttpStack is exposed to subclasses, we provide this implementation in case legacy client apps are dependent on that field. This method may be removed in a future release of Volley.
    com.android.volley.RequestQueue.removeRequestFinishedListener(RequestQueue.RequestFinishedListener<T>)
  • Deprecated Constructors 
    Constructor and Description
    com.android.volley.toolbox.BasicNetwork(HttpStack)
    use BasicNetwork.BasicNetwork(BaseHttpStack) instead to avoid depending on Apache HTTP. This method may be removed in a future release of Volley.
    com.android.volley.toolbox.BasicNetwork(HttpStack, ByteArrayPool)
    use BasicNetwork.BasicNetwork(BaseHttpStack, ByteArrayPool) instead to avoid depending on Apache HTTP. This method may be removed in a future release of Volley.
    com.android.volley.toolbox.ImageRequest(String, Response.Listener<Bitmap>, int, int, Bitmap.Config, Response.ErrorListener)
    com.android.volley.toolbox.JsonRequest(String, String, Response.Listener<T>, Response.ErrorListener)
    Use #JsonRequest(int, String, String, Listener, ErrorListener).
    com.android.volley.NetworkResponse(byte[], Map<String, String>)
    see NetworkResponse.NetworkResponse(int, byte[], boolean, long, List). This constructor cannot handle server responses containing multiple headers with the same name. This constructor may be removed in a future release of Volley.
    com.android.volley.NetworkResponse(int, byte[], Map<String, String>, boolean)
    see NetworkResponse.NetworkResponse(int, byte[], boolean, long, List). This constructor cannot handle server responses containing multiple headers with the same name. This constructor may be removed in a future release of Volley.
    com.android.volley.NetworkResponse(int, byte[], Map<String, String>, boolean, long)
    see NetworkResponse.NetworkResponse(int, byte[], boolean, long, List). This constructor cannot handle server responses containing multiple headers with the same name. This constructor may be removed in a future release of Volley.
    com.android.volley.Request(String, Response.ErrorListener)
    Use Request.Request(int, String, com.android.volley.Response.ErrorListener).
